span.a: You are currently on this page - COVID-19 and District Communications

td.h4: A Message from Whitefish Bay Schools
td.p: The School District of Whitefish Bay is closely monitoring the recent outbreak of respiratory disease caused by a new coronavirus (COVID-19) that was first detected in Wuhan City, Hubei Province, China and which has now been detected in multiple locations internationally, including cases in the United States.

With Governor Tony Evers’ “Safer at Home” order, issued March 24, schools are now closed through at least April 24. The Governor called upon the people of Wisconsin to work aggressively to slow the spread of COVID-19. We recognize a school shutdown places a significant burden on our families, staff and our community.

The Whitefish Bay School District's first and upmost priority is the safety and health of all of the students, staff, families and our greater community. We take this responsibility seriously! We are working closely with our village nurse and our buildings and grounds department to ensure that all current guidelines from the Center for Disease Control (CDC) are being followed to prevent spread of this and other communicable diseases in our school community.

We appreciate your support, as this is new territory for all of us, in and out of education. Our administrative and instructional team are working to navigate this evolving situation and provide inclusive supports. Thank you for working with us in our community’s collective response to COVID-19. We appreciate your patience and understanding. Please visit our website often, as we will be keeping it update as much as possible.

div.span: The School District of Whitefish Bay is working closely with federal, state and local leaders to provide information to our system to ensure the health and safety of their students and educators in creating this ever evolving webiste. The School District of Whitefish Bay shall be held harmless from and against any and all suits, actions, damages, claims, costs, losses or liability of whatsoever kind or character arising from the use of this guiding webiste by other agencies.

li.a: WFB Digital Learning Activities and Resources
